author: Malay Mail
title: In Perak, two men drown after their 4x4 fall into canal and sink in freak accident | Malay Mail
text:
>
IPOH, Dec 29 ‚Äï Police believe two men, who were trapped inside a four-wheel drive that lost control, turned turtle and ploughed into a canal and sank, in Kampung Pulau Pisang, Jalan Bota Kiri-Tanjung Belanja, had drowned, this morning.
Perak Tengah district deputy police chief DSP Mohd Uzir Ismail said during the 11.40am incident, a Toyota Hilux (4X4) that was driven by a 39-year-old, and a 25-year-old passenger, had earlier loaded their 4X4 vehicle with oil palm from a plantation in Kampung Pulau Pisang.
‚ÄúDuring the accident, both the driver and passenger are believed to have been trapped inside the vehicle that sank in the canal. Firefighters later managed to free both of them from the vehicle but both were pronounced dead at the scene,‚Äù he said in a statement last night.
Advertisement He added that initial investigations revealed that the stretch of the road was a straight single narrow lane that was not tarred but the weather was good.
Mohd Uzir said the post-mortem report revealed that the cause of death of the driver was ‚Äúdrowning due to road vehicle accident‚Äù while the passenger died of ‚Äúpulmmonary oedema consistent with drowning due to motor vehicle accident‚Äù.
He added that the case was being investigated and urged anyone with information to contact the investigating officer from the Perak Tengah district police headquarters at 014-6790829 or the nearest police station. ‚Äï Bernama
Advertisement

author: Substitute Patrik Schick scored both goals to preserve Leverkusen‚Äôs unbeaten record.
title: Bayer Leverkusen score twice in stoppage-time to beat Qarabag and stay unbeaten | beIN SPORTS
text: Substitute Patrik Schick scored both goals to preserve Leverkusen‚Äôs unbeaten record. Bundesliga leaders Bayer Leverkusen struck twice in stoppage-time to come from behind and beat 10-man Qarabag 3-2 at the BayArena to reach the quarter-finals of the Europa League. Xabi Alonso‚Äôs side looked set to see their 36-game unbeaten run across all competitions come to an end after goals from Abdellah Zoubir and Juninho either side of a red card for Elvin Cafarguliyev, which was upgraded from a yellow by English referee Anthony Taylor after checking the pitchside monitor. Jeremie Frimpong started the unlikely comeback with 18 minutes left before Patrik Schick ‚Äì whose late goal had secured a 2-2 draw from the first leg in Baku ‚Äì slid home an equaliser and then headed in a dramatic winner deep into stoppage time to secure a 5-4 aggregate victory. The hosts had made a bright start, with Borja Iglesias heading over and then blazing a shot off target after being played into the right side of the penalty area. Iglesias remained a lively threat and tested Qarabag keeper Andrey Lunev with an angled drive at the near post. Leverkusen continued to press, but Amine Adli‚Äôs side-foot effort was too central to trouble Lunev in the 17th minute. Qarabag finally created an opening at the other end when Juninho made space for a shot on goal, which was just wide of the right-hand post. Leverkusen almost made the breakthrough just before half-time when Lunev‚Äôs stray pass across the penalty area was headed goalwards by Iglesias to Adli in the six-yard box. He then nodded the ball back to Florian Wirtz and his shot struck the top-right angle of post and crossbar. The flag, though, went straight up with Adli having been offside. Leverkusen threatened again soon after the restart as substitute Exequiel Palacios dragged his shot wide from the edge of the penalty area. Qarabag stunned the hosts when they broke the deadlock in the 58th minute as Zoubir headed in a cross from Leandro Andrade following a counter attack. The visitors, though, were soon reduced to 10 men. Cafarguliyev tugged back Jeremie Frimpong, who had sprinted clear down the right flank. Although initially shown only a yellow card, Taylor was advised by VAR to check the pitchside monitor and following a lengthy review he eventually brought out the red card. Qarabag, though, struck again in the 67th minute when Juninho swept in a low cross from Marko Vesovic after another swift break. Frimpong pulled a goal back with 18 minutes left, volleying in at the far post from a deep cross through the penalty area by Alejandro Grimaldo. Leverkusen, who had also been 2-0 down in the first leg, pushed for an equaliser as Grimaldo shot wide before then curling a 20-yard effort just over. In the third minute of stoppage time, Schick stabbed the ball past Lunev at the near post from Grimaldo‚Äôs low cross. Just when it looked like Qarabag would hold out to force extra-time, Schick arrived at the far post to nod in Palacios‚Äô cross and send Leverkusen into the last eight.

author: R√©seau International
title: ‚ÄúFrance ordered ECOWAS to take inhumane and illegitimate sanctions‚Äù
text: by Sputnik Africa This is what the vice-president of the Defense and Security Committee of the Transition Council in Mali told Sputnik Africa. ¬´We could not stay in a non-sovereign organization that is ECOWAS‚Äú, said Fousseynou Ouattara. Indeed, after the expulsion of the French ambassador from Mali, Paris went through ECOWAS heads of state to put pressure first on Bamako, then on Ouagadougou and Niamey, he explained. According to him, France is reducing its workforce in Ivory Coast, Senegal and Gabon because ‚ÄúFrance's economy is collapsing¬ª. ¬´France no longer has the means to maintain its troops who are outside French territory. France is no longer a great power. I think that France is joining even its former colonies in the same rank¬ª, concluded the Malian official. As French influence fades on the continent, African heads of state and ministers are turning their eyes towards Russia. The cause is a very different attitude on the part of the Russian side, said the Malian politician. ¬´All eyes are on Russia, because cooperation with Russia is a very clean, very transparent, equal-to-equal cooperation. Russia (‚Ä¶) does not know how to impose its needs on Africa at all. Russia is (‚Ä¶) in a very frank partnership. This is a partnership that we could not find with France¬ª. source: [Sputnik Africa](https://fr.sputniknews.africa/20240131/la-france-ordonnait-a-la-cedeao-de-prendre-des-sanctions-inhumaines-et-illegitimes-1064857938.html)

author: EFE
title: Francia expulsa al im√°n tunecino que calific√≥ de sat√°nica la bandera francesa
text:
Francia ha expulsado de su territorio al im√°n tunecino al que reprochaba declaraciones contra los valores republicanos y llamamientos al odio, que se podr√≠an equiparar a un delito de apolog√≠a del terrorismo, con comentarios que tachaban de sat√°nica la bandera francesa.
"El 'im√°n' radical Mahjoub Mahjoubi acaba de ser expulsado del territorio nacional", ha anunciado a √∫ltima hora de este jueves en la red social X el ministro de Interior galo, G√©rald Darmanin, quien advirti√≥ tambi√©n: "No dejaremos pasar ni una".
La expulsi√≥n del religioso de origen tunecino, al que se abri√≥ una investigaci√≥n el lunes pasado por apolog√≠a del terrorismo, se produjo tan solo doce horas despu√©s de que hubiera sido puesto bajo custodia policial con vistas al procedimiento para hacer efectiva su salida del pa√≠s.
Darmanin ha destacado la velocidad del tr√°mite y asegur√≥ que "no habr√≠a sido posible" sin las disposiciones de la nueva ley de inmigraci√≥n impulsada por su Ministerio.
El delito del im√°n expulsado
Mahjoub Mahjoubi resid√≠a en la localidad de Bagnols sur C√®ze y hab√≠a protagonizado una controvertida grabaci√≥n, emitida en directo por Facebook el pasado 9 de febrero, donde calificaba de "sat√°nica" la bandera francesa y dec√≠a que no tiene "ning√∫n valor para Al√°".
A la vista de la reacci√≥n que provoc√≥ el mensaje, el im√°n rectific√≥ en declaraciones a la prensa y se excus√≥ en una mala utilizaci√≥n del lenguaje y en "un problema de formulaci√≥n". Tambi√©n dijo que en realidad no se refer√≠a a la bandera francesa, sino a las que se han visto en las √∫ltimas semanas durante la Copa Africana de Naciones.
Sin embargo, el prefecto del departamento de Gard, J√©r√¥me Bonet, precis√≥ el pasado martes, al confirmar que se hab√≠a iniciado el tr√°mite para su expulsi√≥n por sus llamamientos al odio, que la decisi√≥n de las autoridades francesas no se basaba √∫nicamente en ese controvertido v√≠deo, sino que se le hab√≠a hecho un seguimiento durante meses por radicalismo.

author: Miriam McNabb
title: Johnette Technologies Wins Indian Army UAV Contract - DRONELIFE
text: Indian Army Awards Contract to Johnnette Technologies for Supply of Made-in-India Johnnette JF-2 Tactical, India‚Äôs First Crash Resistant Drone Johnnette Technologies, a leading Indian Unmanned Systems manufacturer headquartered in Noida, has secured a contract from the Indian Army to supply its flagship tactical fixed-wing UAV, the Johnnette JF-2, for border surveillance. The company proudly asserts that the JF-2 is India‚Äôs first crash-resistant drone, representing a significant milestone in the nation‚Äôs pursuit of self-reliance in defense manufacturing. Founded in 2014 by Lt Cdr John Livingstone, a retired Indian Navy officer, Johnnette Technologies has been at the forefront of developing cutting-edge unmanned systems technology for both military and commercial applications in India. The company‚Äôs commitment aligns with the ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô initiative spearheaded by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi. Lt Cdr John Livingstone, Founder, and CEO of Johnnette Technologies, expressed his pride in contributing to national security: ‚ÄúIt is a great feeling to be able to serve the nation even after retiring from the Defence Forces. My team has done prolonged R&D and have created this tactical fixed-wing UAV, Johnnette JF-2, for the Military requirements. The uniqueness of our lightweight JF-2 is its ability to be crash-resistant in multiple terrains due to its sturdy belly-landing design.‚Äù The Johnnette JF-2 is a hand-launched fixed-wing tactical UAV designed specifically for surveillance and reconnaissance operations. Equipped with a high-definition day camera and a thermal imaging camera, the platform is tailored for day and night operations. Noteworthy features include a crash-proof avionics bay, anti-jamming, and anti-spoofing capabilities, making it an ideal solution for land forces. This marks the first deployment of a fixed-wing UAV in its class by the Indian Army for border surveillance. Johnnette Technologies Pvt Ltd., established in November 2014, has been a trailblazer in Unmanned Systems Technology in India. The company has consistently delivered cutting-edge aerospace systems to the paramilitary, commercial, aerospace, and defense sectors, with a primary focus on unmanned systems technology. In addition to the Johnnette JF-2, the company also manufactures low-cost loitering munitions (Kamikaze drones) and has ambitious plans to produce Medium Altitude Long Endurance (MALE) Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicles (UCAVs) in the future. As India continues to strengthen its indigenous defense capabilities, Johnnette Technologies‚Äô innovative contributions underscore the growing role of domestic firms in meeting the evolving requirements of the armed forces. Read more: [Archer Aviation, InterGlobe Enterprises Plan All-Electric Air Taxi Service Across India by 2026](https://dronelife.com/2023/11/10/archer-aviation-interglobe-enterprises-plan-all-electric-air-taxi-service-across-india-by-2026/) [India‚Äôs Garuda Aerospace Opens Retail Drone Stores](https://dronelife.com/2023/11/10/indias-garuda-aerospace-opens-retail-drone-stores/) [Indian State Supports Domestic Drone Industry with Agricultural Mechanization Subsidy](https://dronelife.com/2023/09/27/indian-state-supports-domestic-drone-industry-with-agricultural-mechanization-subsidy/) [India‚Äôs Minister of Civil Aviation Raises National Flag with Fleet of Drones](https://dronelife.com/2023/08/16/indias-minister-of-civil-aviation-raises-national-flag-with-fleet-of-drones/) Miriam McNabb is the Editor-in-Chief of DRONELIFE and CEO of JobForDrones, a professional drone services marketplace, and a fascinated observer of the emerging drone industry and the regulatory environment for drones. Miriam has penned over 3,000 articles focused on the commercial drone space and is an international speaker and recognized figure in the industry. Miriam has a degree from the University of Chicago and over 20 years of experience in high tech sales and marketing for new technologies. For drone industry consulting or writing, [Email Miriam](mailto:miriam@dronelife.com). TWITTER: [@spaldingbarker](https://twitter.com/spaldingbarker) Subscribe to DroneLife [here](https://dronelife.us8.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=5cdad320c6921b55059dc6269&id=3407389e35).

author: La r√©daction avec AFP
title: Religion. ¬´ Situation pr√©occupante ¬ª pour le pape Fran√ßois, toujours dans un √©tat critique
text:
Religion ¬´ Situation pr√©occupante ¬ª pour le pape Fran√ßois, toujours dans un √©tat critique
Le pape Fran√ßois, hospitalis√© pour une pneumonie et dont l'√©tat de sant√© √©tait ¬´ critique ¬ª samedi soir, ¬´ a pass√© une nuit tranquille ¬ª, a annonc√© dimanche le Vatican.
Apr√®s plusieurs jours d'accalmie, l'√©tat de sant√© du pape Fran√ßois s'est d√©grad√© ces derni√®res 24 heures. Le pontife argentin de 88 ans, pour lequel le diagnostic des m√©decins √©tait ¬´ r√©serv√© ¬ª samedi soir, a toutefois ¬´ pass√© une nuit tranquille et s'est repos√© ¬ª √† l'h√¥pital Gemelli de Rome, a annonc√© le Vatican sur sa cha√Æne Telegram.
Le chef de l'√âglise catholique est hospitalis√© depuis le 14 f√©vrier pour une pneumonie des deux poumons et son √©tat s'est d√©grad√© samedi avec ¬´ une crise asthmatique prolong√©e qui a n√©cessit√© l'application d'oxyg√®ne √† haut d√©bit ¬ª, selon le dernier bulletin de sant√©. ¬´ Les analyses de sang effectu√©es aujourd'hui ont √©galement r√©v√©l√© une thrombop√©nie (baisse du nombre de plaquettes sanguines), associ√©e √† une an√©mie, qui a n√©cessit√© l'administration d'une transfusion sanguine.
Prochains jours ¬´ d√©terminants ¬ª
Le Saint-P√®re reste alerte et a pass√© la journ√©e dans un fauteuil, bien qu'il souffre davantage qu'hier. Le pronostic est actuellement r√©serv√© ¬ª, a pr√©cis√© le Vatican dans ce communiqu√© au ton d'une rare gravit√©. D√®s vendredi apr√®s-midi les m√©decins qui s'occupent du pape avaient mis en garde sur la fragilit√© de la situation. ¬´ Le pape est-il hors de danger ? Non, le pape n'est pas hors de danger ¬ª, avait affirm√© le Pr Sergio Alfieri lors d'une conf√©rence de presse √† l'h√¥pital Gemelli. ¬´ Le vrai risque dans ces cas-l√† est que les germes passent dans le sang ¬ª, provoquant ainsi une septic√©mie potentiellement mortelle, avait-il expliqu√©.
¬´ La situation est devenue plus pr√©occupante ¬ª, a d√©clar√© le virologue Fabrizio Pregliasco, cit√© dimanche par le quotidien La Stampa. ¬´ L'√¢ge du Saint P√®re, ainsi que les ant√©c√©dents de sant√©, comme par exemple la bronchite asthmatique, pourraient avoir compliqu√© les choses et pas qu'un peu ¬ª, d√©taille-t-il. ¬´ Il faut esp√©rer que la th√©rapie antibiotique fonctionne pour √©viter le risque d'une septic√©mie, une infection syst√©mique, qui peut avoir une issue fatale. Le pape est certainement en de bonnes mains mais les prochaines heures et les prochains jours seront d√©terminants ¬ª, estime l'expert.
Pri√®res √† travers le monde
Il sera hospitalis√© au moins toute la semaine prochaine et il ne dirigera pas dimanche, pour la deuxi√®me fois d'affil√©e, la pri√®re de l'Ang√©lus. En d√©but de matin√©e, une messe se tiendra au Vatican lors de laquelle le pro-pr√©fet du dicast√®re pour l'√âvang√©lisation lira l'hom√©lie pr√©par√©e par le pape. Plusieurs responsables religieux et politiques ont dit prier pour le pape. Depuis samedi soir sur les r√©seaux sociaux, les internautes ont aussi post√© des centaines de messages disant prier pour Fran√ßois, beaucoup postant une photo de l'√©v√™que de Rome seul sur la place Saint-Pierre lors de la pand√©mie de Covid-19.
Fran√ßois a √©t√© hospitalis√© initialement pour une bronchite, mais le Saint-Si√®ge a r√©v√©l√© mardi qu'il avait d√©velopp√© une pneumonie dans les deux poumons, une infection du tissu pulmonaire potentiellement mortelle. Cette hospitalisation, la quatri√®me depuis 2021, suscite de vives inqui√©tudes alors que le pape a d√©j√† √©t√© affaibli par une s√©rie de probl√®mes ces derni√®res ann√©es, allant d'op√©rations du c√¥lon et de l'abdomen √† des difficult√©s √† marcher.
L'hospitalisation du pape, √† la fois chef spirituel des 1,4 milliard de catholiques dans le monde et chef de l'Etat de la Cit√© du Vatican, a relanc√© les interrogations autour de sa capacit√© √† assurer sa charge, alors que le droit canonique ne pr√©voit aucune disposition en cas de probl√®me grave qui alt√®rerait sa lucidit√©.

author: Movieguide¬Æ
title: Heptathlete Anna Hall Trusts God Amid Setbacks, Successes: ‚ÄòStay Faithful‚Äô
text:
Heptathlete Anna Hall Trusts God Amid Setbacks, Successes: ‚ÄòStay Faithful‚Äô
By Movieguide¬Æ Contributor
USA heptathlete Anna Hall clings to her faith amid setbacks and successes.
‚ÄúThe year that I transferred, I actually fell at Olympic trials in 2021,‚Äù Hall
said on the ‚ÄúSports Spectrum‚Äù podcast. ‚ÄúI was like I had an outside shot to make the team. I was really young, but that was like crushing, and I like could not understand, like, what was happening. My coach left the school I was at. I transferred. It was just like so much going on.‚Äù
‚ÄúI think my faith is what brought me through, and I just like grew stronger in my faith through that and knowing that there was a plan for later and then was able to bounce back from that injury incredibly well coming into the next year and doing really well at Worlds and that surprise first bronze medal,‚Äù she
continued. ‚ÄúI feel like that ended up being kind of just a visual I use for the rest of my life. When something goes wrong, there‚Äôs something better coming if you just stay faithful.‚Äù
‚ÄúTo me, [Jesus] is my Lord and Savior,‚Äù she declared. ‚ÄúJesus is the reason that we‚Äôre here and that we‚Äôre able to have hope and that affects all aspects of my life.‚Äù
As Hall has grown more in her faith, she has also become more unashamed and often shares Bible verses on her social media.
As she faced another injury a few months ago, Hall
wrote, ‚ÄúComebacks suck. But they are always worth it. As difficult as it was I‚Äôm thankful to be out there competing again, and now have 10 weeks to chase progress. I‚Äôm fighting hard. Thanks for the kind messages, I feel them all.‚Äù
She also shared Isaiah 43:2, which
reads, ‚ÄúWhen you go through deep waters, I will be with you. When you go through rivers of difficulty, you will not drown. When you walk through the fire of oppression, you will not be burned up; the flames will not consume you.‚Äù
She‚Äôs also hoping to make the 2024 Olympic team. Sports Spectrum
reported, ‚ÄúHall will compete at the 2024 U.S. Track and Field Olympic Trials on June 23-24 to earn her berth to represent the United States at the Paris Games (July 26-Aug. 11).‚Äù
For more inspiring sports stories, check out
Sports Spectrum.
Movieguide¬Æ previously
https://www.movieguide.org/news-articles/heptathlete-anna-hall-trusts-god-amid-2024-olympics-prep.html on Hall:
Heptathlete Anna Hall keeps her focus on God amid losses and injuries as she looks ahead to the 2024 Paris Olympics.
Hall landed a silver medal at the World Championships last week in Budapest, leaving her disappointed and grateful.
After the race, Hall
[expressed], ‚ÄúI went for it. Very bittersweet. I really wanted gold and I just fought my heart out and it just wasn‚Äôt there this year for me. Kat was just better today, and I got beat.‚Äù
Hall shared on X, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs possible to be heartbroken and thankful at the same time. I love this sport. Thanks for all the love xx.‚Äù
Share:

author: PTI
title: Thick fog reduces visibility in large parts of Punjab, Haryana | Science-Environment
text: Thick fog reduces visibility in large parts of Punjab, Haryana [PTI](/pti-stories)| Chandigarh | Updated: 29-12-2023 10:48 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 10:48 IST - Country: - India A thick blanket of fog enveloped most parts of Punjab and Haryana on Friday morning, reducing visibility, meteorological department officials said. Fog also impacted visibility in Chandigarh, the common capital of the two states. Minimum temperatures hovered close to normal limits at most places in Punjab and Haryana. In Punjab, Amritsar recorded a minimum temperature of 9.9 degrees Celsius, Ludhiana 9 degrees Celsius and Patiala 9.5 degrees Celsius. Pathankot recorded a low of 8.8 degrees Celsius and Faridkot 8.6 degrees Celsius. In Haryana, the mercury settled at a low of 9.8 degrees Celsius in Ambala and at 8.2 degrees Celsius in Hisar. Karnal recorded a minimum temperature of 9.4 degrees Celsius, Rohtak 9.6 degrees Celsius and Sirsa 9.8 degrees Celsius. Chandigarh recorded a minimum temperature of 8 degrees Celsius. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
